adjective.description: Relating to the shoulder or shoulder blade.

noun.description: A short monastic cloak covering the shoulders.
A bandage passing over and around the shoulders.

origin: Late 15th century (in scapular (sense 1 of the noun)): from late Latin scapulare, from scapula shoulder. The adjective (late 17th century) and the later senses of the noun are from scapula + -ar.
